intro: Serrafalcus hordeaceus, commonly known as the barley-leaf fern, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in temperate regions and thrives in well-drained soils. It has a rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread vegetatively. Serrafalcus hordeaceus is often used in ornamental gardening for its elegant appearance and adaptability to various conditions.
